column1: Councils Ordinance together with section 2 of the said Act No. 12 of 1989. It is important
to highlight the following paragraph in CA/Writ/51/2021;

column2: “The learned President’s Counsel for the Petitioner submitted that in any event, the impugned
Order ‘P22’ is ultra vires the powers conferred on the 1st Respondent by Section 247 of the

column1: Urban  Councils  Ordinance  and  Section  2  of

column2: Provisions) Act No. 12 of 1989. To me, the series of events that followed the refusal by the
Petitioner to place the re-submitted budget to a vote and have it passed by the Council reflects
the desperation on the part of the Respondents to ensure that the provisions of Section 178A
are complied with. Even if the argument of the learned President’s Counsel for the Petitioner
is accepted, nothing flows  from ‘P22’ for the reason  that ‘P22’ is only an intimation of a

column1: factual position that prevailed as at that date.”
